instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD</SIGNAL> Reading 3.3V Instead of 1.8V
threads.message:
This board came with no power. Stuck at 5V. After inspection I discovered the 2 left USB-C ports keep resetting the charger. After some measurements I found that 
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD</SIGNAL> is giving around 3V instead of expected 1.8V. I then replaced <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> as it's the component that generates this voltage, but got same result. All other 3 controllers have correct 1.8V on their equivalent line. Any ideas on what could be causing this anomaly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD</SIGNAL> Reading 3.3V Instead of 1.8V
threads.message:
Check resistance between that LDO and any other 3V3 power rail around <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>.
Compare with another channel.
You may have leakage inside board.
